channel.title: Cutbacks
channel.description:
Has anyone else noticed subtle changes in the food industry? Changes not like new logo's, but like in the packaging of food, and the portions. If any of you like Rice Krispies Treats, you'd notice the plastic packaging around the squares has actually gotten thinner. Another Kellogg's product that's changed, is Pop Tart's. They're actually shortened the pop tart itself, you'll notice that when both pop tarts are pressed to the bottom of the packaging there's a good cm of clearance from the pop tart to the seal on the packaging. It used to not have that clearance. They've gotten thinner as well, also with less icing.
I'm not some food nut or anything, I was just pointing out how the American economy has affected some of the businesses.

item.title: Cutbacks
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:31, topic:291617”][quote author=Elijah link=topic=385359.msg2889854#msg2889854 date=1248828835]

:s are you telling me the economy has effected the frosting level of your poptarts? something does not sound correct…

Not just of my pop tarts… but America’s pop tarts.


[/quote]

Fuck you guys are big headed, in the UK we tend not to paint our flag on everything, especially not our fod products. If it is grown in the UK then we put a tiny Union Jack on the packaging.

I’m not saying we aren’t as proud or patriotic as you guys, just not so arrogant about it. One of the few things I hate about America (or am jealous of).

I don’t even know what a strudel is? Stupid American food!

An Apfel Strudel is German. Americans probably made their own crazy variant of it.

Probably covered in peanut butter.[/quote]

Don’t feel jealous, I wouldn’t. I hate America’s patriotism.

Read full topic

item.title: Cutbacks
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

Man UTD Freak:

Most of us who eat Chips should have noticed how the level of Chips in each Chip packet has gradually been decreasing. Half of the Chip packet is basically Air and the other half being the Chip content.

If I remember correctly they do that so the air can “cushion” the chips so they don’t break. I also think there is another reason but I don’t remember that.

Read full topic

item.title: Cutbacks
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Tico, post:11, topic:291617”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=385359.msg2892140#msg2892140 date=1248967455]

A companies main goal is profit, if some douche who works on the manufacturing line comes up to his boss and says “if we halve the amount of frosting on the pop tart then we can save lots of $$$$$$” then the boss is gonna lap that up.

Then they decide people are stupid enough not to notice the lack of frosting and go ahead in doing it.

P.s. i’ve never eaten a pop tart so I don’t know if what I said makes any sense.

do we even have pop tarts in our country?
[/quote]

If you don’t, it’s a shame, because pop tarts are awesome.

Yeah, I kinda did notice there was a little less pop tart the last time I bought them. It wasn’t that big of a change, but it was definitely something I noticed.[/quote]
we get bakewell tarts dunno if a pop tart is like that

Read full topic

item.title: Cutbacks
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I don’t know if it’s an international brand or not, but I like cup-a-soup when I’m eating. I especially like the mushroom soup. But the manufacturer came up with an ‘improved’ recipe, and now it tastes like vomit. I don’t know if the reason for this new recipe is the crisis, but I sure do hate it.

I always hate new recipes of food that already tastes good btw.

Read full topic
